title: 26 MPs in last parliament cause Rs. 220 Mn loss to Govt in housing purchases
byline: Twenty six MPs of the last government whose houses came under arson attacks during the Aragalayaa in 2022 have purchased houses from the Viyathpura housing scheme at nominal prices causing heavy losses amounting to Rs. 220 million to the government , Deputy Minister of Housing T. B. Sarath said in Parliament yesterday.

title: Buwaneka claims silver at HUNDRED Sri Lanka Series
byline: Sri Lanka’s Buwaneka Goonethilleka had to settle with a silver medal as Indonesia’s Jeland Fajar and Thailand’s Tidapron Kleebyeesun were crowned champions of the HUNDRED Sri Lanka International Series 2025, which concluded at the St. Joseph’s College Indoor Complex in Darley Road, Colombo.

title: Construction on second terminal at BIA will begin soon: Bimal
byline: The work on the second terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) will begin this year, Minister of Aviation Bimal Ratnayke told Parliament today.

title: Japan first among Sri Lanka’s OCC bilateral creditors to ink restructure agreements
byline: Japan yesterday became the first bilateral creditor among the Official Creditor Committee (OCC) to restructure Sri Lanka’s bilateral external debt worth US $ 2.5 billion and unlocking doors to new projects.

title: Public urged to be vigilant against AI-generated videos misusing CBSL Governor’s image
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has advised the public to remain vigilant against fraudulent artificial intelligence (AI)-generated videos, misusing the image of the CBSL Governor to deceive individuals online.

title: Sri Lankan boat found capsized near Periyathalai
byline: Periyathalai fishermen salvaged a Sri Lankan boat that was found capsized and floating in the sea, and brought it to the shore.

title: 216 girls under 16 became pregnant last year: Opposition MP
byline: Opposition MP Rohini Kaviratne revealed in Parliament today that 216 girls under the age of 16 became pregnant in Sri Lanka last year.

title: Male teacher assaults female teacher in Embilipitiya: PM
byline: Disciplinary action will be taken against the male teacher who had assaulted a female teacher at a school in Embilipitiya, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.
